EtBsdZrPckAL35qKK5NsWA.text: This is one of the best Italian restaurant in Singapore, in my opinion. The quality of the cooking is in the league of Valentino's although they do not have as much traditional cooked items (and I am not complaining as long as what is on the menu is done well). In terms of ambience, I am glad they have shifted to Greenwood Avenue from Jln Pemimpin. The restaurant offers modern, chic, casual dining and is much larger with both indoor and outdoor seating vs its previous location. Its staff strength has also swelled to cater to the larger seating capacity.  Marcus and his team always makes me feel welcome whenever I drop by. If you drive (and parking is a bitch here), there's a valet service. I love the squid ink pasta and squid ink risotto which you don't need to pre-order, unlike Valentino's. You can taste the freshness and tenderness of the seafood, plus the pasta and risotto are done al dente (and I am pretty fussy that this basic stuff ought to be done right) as it should.  They are prepared using authentic squid ink sauce and not squid ink pasta.  The pizza is good too (thin crust) with just the right amount of balance between cheese and ingredients and their seafood is one of the freshest you can get. I was told the seafood is hand-picked at the fish market every morning.  I have no complaints about the steak, nicely grilled on the outside and juicy and tender (not chewy) on the inside, cooked as well as can be expected. In summary, the quality and consistency of the food here is amazing considering the copious amount of food being prepared for its ravenous crowd.And the chocolate verdant dessert is to die for, crispy on the outside and soft molten chocolate lava flowing from the inside.  We tend to over-eat and often end up with no room for dessert. When we are here, we make sure we exercise restrain so that we don't miss out on the dessert. The wine menu has also been much improved and now comes with a much larger variety of Italian wine.  It's a great place to dine with a large group of friends or with the family. And having said that, I should organize a group dinner here soon. I am glad to see that it is crowded and the restaurant is doing well so that more people in Singapore will continue to enjoy quality Italian fare.Bon appetit!!

uG1XaI3MOc8gMRI9MwAtaQ.text: Lunch set at $19.90++Be warned, the set lunch portions are SMALL! It started with a cioppino (3 stars). The seafood didn't taste very fresh and the soup/stew itself was unremarkable. The main, a spaghetti aglio olio (3 stars) with tiger prawns, was cooked al dente. Major plus points. But again the prawns didn't taste fresh and had the sort of crunchy flavorless texture that makes me dislike prawns. Lastly, you get coffee/tea OR tiramisu. We had the tiramisu (3 stars). The small slice didn't wow - I thought my aunt's tiramisu tasted better.The pizza we had came with artichokes, black olives, Parma ham (4 stars). This was far better! Thin crust, but not very generous with the ingredients.Don't think I'll be in a hurry to come back.

fH0OdKbgwemu4w8H1UmB2Q.text: This a nice tucked away treat.. Not far from anything.. However not main street.The food is almost as awesome as the service, which is exceptional. The staff are great, such a refreshing change to have competent and knowledgeable staff. This is important as they steer you in the right direction.The food is amazing, there probably isn't a bad dish.. Probably.. All that I have had are amazing.The starters are great. And the mains are so very generous and tasty. The Italian theme doesn't overpower the food, and they cater for all tastes.Having been with children too.. I can assure they cater for them too.Great for couples, groups and families. Have the Seafood in a Bag.. Just perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Rubato Modern Italian Trattoria - Singapore, Singapore. Pork trotter anyone
Photo of Rubato Modern Italian Trattoria - Singapore, Singapore. Seafood Pizza... Thin base and chunky seafood... That's the way to proportion it..
Photo of Rubato Modern Italian Trattoria - Singapore, Singapore. Seafood in a Bag.. And that's what it is... Generous and fantastic

GbUeOS4atPyZLM5qFRUUPw.text: Three words... All day brunch.  How can anyone say no to that?  I mean the Genius!! And they also offer organic options, free flow Procecco, I mean how can you say NO!  That is the genius of this restaurant.  All of the best offerings are here, no need to go anywhere else.  Best of the best dishes? Of course the organic Eggs Benny.  fish and chops are also to fire for. crunchy inside and not soggy or to great.  chips are nice and firm with a bit of a softness on the inside, the best are the beef meatballs.  yes, I who does not eat meat on the regular for dietary reasons, cannot get enough of these.  These meaty morales are flavorful and succulent ...OH I could eat some now just thinking about it!!I digress,  they do have an awesome full Italian menu but honestly, u cannot get past the all day brunch.  Service is speculation ask for vijay he will give you the best wine recommendation.

7UuC0RW4kiIi4BVJI4SM0A.text: Love this place! Delicious food, LOVELY service, and a nice atmosphere. This is my go to place for weekend lunches, but it's honestly good for any occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Rubato Modern Italian Trattoria - Singapore, Singapore. Caprese salad and mussels.

2bKuxPI0llCt1NH-7WWOCg.text: Great service with the staff giving us a delicious dessert platter upon finding out that one of our party were celebrating his birthday, food that shines with the deliciousness of the produce and surprisingly reasonable prices. There's basically nothing much more you can ask for. The drinks list is quite comprehensive as well.

R-1J-B-L20gZ6lIyurhc6A.text: Based off lunch.Went there for lunch one day with my sister because we were tired of Lucky Place Coffee Shop and Pepperoni's. Will never go back again. I think the only okay was the coffee. Oysters had sand, the rest of the food was difficult to finish... service was poor. They don't bother waiting for you to finish your food before bringing out the next course... (and why the rush? There were, what, 3 occupied tables?)Horrid experience, although the ambiance was nice, being quiet and well done up. Bright side was that the food was so bad we could focus on conversation.

lBZdcPsQtQ7xecrdm6xEcQ.text: Very delicious food and portion side was perfect......portions tend to be small in Singapore restaurants.  Tasted fresh and service was the best I have experienced in Singapore.  I had Linguine Vongole, clams were well cooked with a light white wine broth.  My husband had seafood pasta in a bag.  It was really cooked in a bag.  The tomatoe sauce was light and did not over power the seafood.  The owner was very kind and welcoming.  My husband and I had a very pleasant conversation with her.  It was very nice of her to take time from her busy restaurant.  She was very attentive to all customers and her wait staff was well trained in providing great service.  Well worth the price.

lhh6sxZdocva7uSa5iHVcQ.text: Modern-chic space with ample seating options, indoors and outdoors. Wait staff attentive and knowledgeable (of the menu). Menu with quite a wide variety of modern Italian fare. Food was delicious - we went for dinner and had the Scallop Pasta as well as the Burrata and Parma Ham Pizza. Both were delicious.

iHr0G7Sbsdp4yI89uLIJrw.text: Really liked this place. Great food and service. Price accordingly to quality of the food. Definitely worth a come back. Burrata was excellent.
